018package org.tquadrat.foundation.ap;
019
020import static java.lang.reflect.Proxy.isProxyClass;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.DebugOutput.ifDebug;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
026
027import javax.annotation.processing.Messager;
028import javax.annotation.processing.ProcessingEnvironment;
029import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationMirror;
030import javax.lang.model.element.AnnotationValue;
031import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
032import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
033import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
034import javax.tools.Diagnostic;
035import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
036import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
037import java.util.Optional;
038import java.util.Set;
039import java.util.StringJoiner;
040
041import org.apiguardian.api.API;
042import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
043
044/**
045 *  The specification for a set of helpers for annotation processing.
046 *
047 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
048 *  @version $Id: APHelper.java 997 2022-01-26 14:55:05Z tquadrat $
049 *  @since 0.1.0
050 *
051 *  @UMLGraph.link
052 */
053@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: APHelper.java 997 2022-01-26 14:55:05Z tquadrat $" )
054@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
055public interface APHelper extends Messager, ProcessingEnvironment
056{
057        /*---------*\
058    ====** Methods **==========================================================
059        \*---------*/
060    /**
061     *  <p>{@summary Returns the flag that indicates whether some debug
062     *  information should be emitted to the generated code.}</p>
063     *  <p>The value is controlled by the value of the annotation processor
064     *  option
065     *  {@value APBase#ADD_DEBUG_OUTPUT}.</p>
066     *
067     *  @return {@code true} if the debug information should be added,
068     *      {@code false} if not.
069     */
070    public boolean addDebugOutput();
071
072    /**
073     *  Retrieves the
074     *  {@link AnnotationMirror}
075     *  for the given annotation
076     *  from the given
077     *  {@link Element}
078     *  instance. Only declared annotations are considered, not the inherited
079     *  ones.
080     *
081     *  @param  element The element.
082     *  @param  annotationClass The annotation to look for.
083     *  @return An instance of
084     *      {@link Optional}
085     *      that holds the found {@code AnnotationMirror} instance.
086     *
087     *  @see Element#getAnnotationMirrors()
088     */
089    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationMirror> getAnnotationMirror( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass )
090    {
091        final var isProxyClass = isProxyClass( requireNonNullArgument( annotationClass, "annotationClass" ) );
092        ifDebug( a -> "annotationClass = %s".formatted( ((Class<?>) a [0]).getName() ), annotationClass );
093        final String annotationClassName;
094        if( isProxyClass )
095        {
096            final var interfaces = annotationClass.getInterfaces();
097            ifDebug( interfaces.length > 1, i ->
098            {
099                final var joiner = new StringJoiner( ", ", "annotation interface: ", EMPTY_STRING );
100                //noinspection SuspiciousArrayCast
101                for( final var c : ((Class<?> []) i) )
102                {
103                    joiner.add( c.getName() );
104                }
105                return joiner.toString();
106            }, (Object []) interfaces );
107            if( interfaces.length != 1 )
108                throw new AnnotationProcessingError( format( "annotationClass proxy '%s' implements more than one interface" ) );
109            annotationClassName = interfaces [0].getName();
110        }
111        else
112        {
113            annotationClassName = requireNonNullArgument( annotationClass, "annotationClass" ).getName();
114        }
115        ifDebug( "effective annotationClassName = %s"::formatted, annotationClassName );
116        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getAnnotationMirrors().stream()
117            .filter( m -> m.getAnnotationType().toString().equals( annotationClassName ) )
118            .findFirst();
119        ifDebug( retValue.isEmpty(), e ->
120        {
121            final var joiner = new StringJoiner( ", ", "annotationMirrors: ", EMPTY_STRING );
122            for( final var mirror : ((Element) e [0]).getAnnotationMirrors() )
123            {
124                joiner.add( mirror.getAnnotationType().toString() );
125            }
126            return joiner.toString();
127        }, element );
128
129        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
130        return retValue;
131    }   //  getAnnotationMirror()
132
133    /**
134     *  Retrieves the annotation value from the given annotation mirror.
135     *
136     *  @param  annotationMirror    The annotation mirror.
137     *  @return An instance of
138     *      {@link Optional}
139     *      that holds the found annotation value.
140     */
141    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationValue> getAnnotationValue( final AnnotationMirror annotationMirror )
142    {
143        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, "value" );
144
145        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
146        return retValue;
147    }   //  getAnnotationValue()
148
149    /**
150     *  Retrieves the annotation value with the given name from the given
151     *  annotation mirror.
152     *
153     *  @param  annotationMirror    The annotation mirror.
154     *  @param  name    The name of the desired value.
155     *  @return An instance of
156     *      {@link Optional}
157     *      that holds the found annotation value.
158     */
159    public default Optional<? extends AnnotationValue> getAnnotationValue( final AnnotationMirror annotationMirror, final String name )
160    {
161        final var elementValues = getElementUtils().getElementValuesWithDefaults( annotationMirror );
162        @SuppressWarnings( "unlikely-arg-type" )
163        final var retValue = elementValues.keySet().stream()
164            .filter( k -> k.getSimpleName().toString().equals( name ) )
165            .map( elementValues::get )
166            .findAny();
167
168        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
169        return retValue;
170    }   //  getAnnotationValue()
171
172    /**
173     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves a
174     *  {@link TypeMirror}
175     *  instance from an annotation.}</p>
176     *  <p>In case an annotation defines a
177     *  {@link Class Class&lt;?&gt;}
178     *  attribute, the value for that attribute is either {@code null} or
179     *  something strange, but never an instance of {@code Class<?>}. So
180     *  we need some special code to get something useful from the
181     *  annotation.</p>
182     *  <p>This implementations assumes the default name
183     *  &quot;<code>value</code>&quot; for the attribute.</p>
184     *
185     *  @param  element The annotated element.
186     *  @param  annotationClass The type of the annotation.
187     *  @return An instance of
188     *      {@link Optional}
189     *      that holds the {@code TypeMirror}
190     *      instance.
191     *  @throws NoSuchElementException  The given element is not annotated with
192     *      an annotation of the given type.
193     */
194    public default Optional<TypeMirror> getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass )
195    {
196        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( element, annotationClass )
197            .orElseThrow( () -> new NoSuchElementException( annotationClass.getName() ) );
198
199        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror )
200            .map( annotationValue -> (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
201
202        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
203        return retValue;
204    }   //  getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue()
205
206    /**
207     *  <p>{@summary Retrieves a
208     *  {@link TypeMirror}
209     *  instance from an annotation.}</p>
210     *  <p>In case an annotation defines a
211     *  {@link Class Class&lt;?&gt;}
212     *  attribute, the value for that attribute is either {@code null} or
213     *  something strange, but never an instance of {@code Class<?>}. So we
214     *  need some special code to get something useful from the annotation.</p>
215     *
216     *  @param  element The annotated element.
217     *  @param  annotationClass The type of the annotation.
218     *  @param  attributeName   The name of the attribute that holds the class.
219     *  @return An instance of
220     *      {@link Optional}
221     *      that holds the {@code TypeMirror}
222     *      instance.
223     *  @throws NoSuchElementException  The given element is not annotated with
224     *      an annotation of the given type.
225     */
226    public default Optional<TypeMirror> getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue( final Element element, final Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass, final String attributeName )
227    {
228        final var annotationMirror = getAnnotationMirror( element, annotationClass )
229            .orElseThrow( () -> new NoSuchElementException( annotationClass.getName() ) );
230
231        final var retValue = getAnnotationValue( annotationMirror, attributeName )
232            .map( annotationValue -> (TypeMirror) annotationValue.getValue() );
233
234        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
235        return retValue;
236    }   //  getTypeMirrorFromAnnotationValue()
237
238    /**
239     *  Checks whether the given element has the given annotation.
240     *
241     *  @note If the retention for the given annotation is not
242     *      {@link java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy#RUNTIME RUNTIME}
243     *      it could have been removed from the element in an earlier compile
244     *      run.
245     *
246     *  @param  <A> The type of the annotation.
247     *  @param  element The element to inspect.
248     *  @param  annotationType  The type of the annotation to look for.
249     *  @return {@code true} if the element is annotated with the given
250     *      annotation, {@code false} if not.
251     *
252     *  @see java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy#RUNTIME
253     */
254    public default <A extends Annotation> boolean hasAnnotation( final Element element, final Class<A> annotationType )
255    {
256        final var annotation = requireNonNullArgument( element, "element" ).getAnnotation( requireNonNullArgument( annotationType, "annotationType" ) );
257        final var retValue = annotation != null;
258
259        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
260        return retValue;
261    }   //  hasAnnotation()
262
263    /**
264     *  {@inheritDoc}
265     */
266    @Override
267    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg )
268    {
269        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg );
270    }   //  printMessage()
271
272    /**
273     *  {@inheritDoc}
274     */
275    @Override
276    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element )
277    {
278        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element );
279    }   //  printMessage()
280
281    /**
282     *  {@inheritDoc}
283     */
284    @Override
285    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element, final AnnotationMirror annotation )
286    {
287        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element, annotation );
288    }   //  printMessage()
289
290    /**
291     *  {@inheritDoc}
292     */
293    @Override
294    public default void printMessage( final Diagnostic.Kind kind, final CharSequence msg, final Element element, final AnnotationMirror annotation, final AnnotationValue value )
295    {
296        getMessager().printMessage( kind, msg, element, annotation, value );
297    }   //  printMessage()
298
299    /**
300     *  Retrieves the interfaces are that implemented or extended by the given
301     *  type element.
302     *
303     *  @param  typeElement The type element to inspect.
304     *  @param  interfaces  The already retrieved interfaces.
305     */
306    public default void retrieveInterfaces( final TypeElement typeElement, final Set<? super TypeElement> interfaces )
307    {
308        interfaces.add( typeElement );
309
310        for( final var typeMirror : typeElement.getInterfaces() )
311        {
312            final var nextInterface = (TypeElement) getTypeUtils().asElement( typeMirror );
313            if( !interfaces.contains( nextInterface ) )
314            {
315                retrieveInterfaces( nextInterface, interfaces );
316            }
317        }
318    }   //  retrieveInterfaces()
319}
320//  class APHelper
321
322/*
323 *  End of File
324 */
